bibl.title: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, November 2, 1947

div1.p: Wyllie agrees that Hench should bring the Reed materials for exhibit on his person rather than shipping them.

div1.head: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, November 2, 1947
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
2 November 1947
DIVISION OF RARE BOOKS
AND
MANUSCRIPTS
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I very much appreciate your willingness to
cooperate with us on an exhibit, and I think your
suggestion about bringing some things with you is
the solution, particularly since the list you have
been good enough to send baffles me with its richness.
I wouldn't be able to select a few without regretting
the others. We can set up an exhibit of our own before
your talk, and then expand it after you have brought
us some additional items of your own. After you arrive,
we can arrange the details of insurance and return.

The clippings are just what I wanted. Am having
a photostat made of the Post-Bulletin one", and will have it
back in the mails in a few days. The photograph and reprints
have not yet arrived.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, John Cook Wyllie
Curator of Rare Books Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
" La April 4, 1942
